intro: Schizobasopsis volubilis, commonly known as the climbing false nettle, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, twining stems that enable it to climb and spread over other vegetation. The plant features pinnately compound leaves with serrated edges, and small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels. It is typically found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks. Schizobasopsis volubilis is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
